alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Chouteau; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 6:49AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm with frequent lightning and very heavy rain will continue to impact portions of northwestern Judith Basin, southwestern Chouteau and east central Cascade Counties through 745 AM MDT... At 646 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Belt, or 23 miles east of Great Falls, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Frequent lightning and locally heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rain may cause ponding of water on roadways and in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Belt and Armington. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 2. Highway 89 between mile markers 70 and 71, and between mile markers 72 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
